bibl.title: Letter from Alexander M. Wilson to Howard A. Kelly, July 30, 1907

div1.p: Wilson sends a contribution for Kissinger.

div1.head: Letter from Alexander M. Wilson to Howard A. Kelly, July 30, 1907
div1.opener:
CHICAGO TUBERCULOSIS INSTITUTE
HENRY B. FAVILL, M.D.
PRESIDENT.
FRANK BILLINGS, M.D.
FIRST VICE-PRESIDENT.
ROBERT H. BABCOOK, M.D.
SECOND VICE-PRESIDENT
DAVID R. FORGAN,
TREASURER.
ERNEST P. BICKNELL,
SECRETARY.
ETHAN A. GRAY, M.D,
CHAIRMAN EXECUTIVE COM.
ADDITIONAL DIRECTORS
W. A. EVANS, M.D. ARNOLD C. KLENS, M.D. MISS HARRIET FULMER, MRS. ROBERT McGANN,
THEODORE H. MACHS, M.D. JOHN A. ROBINSON, M.D. SHERMAN C. KINGSLEY, MRS. JESSE L. MOSS,
L. HEKTOEN, M.D. EDWIN W. RYERSON, M.D. STANLEY McCORMICK, MRS. JAMES L. HOUGHTELING.
MRS. ARTHUR ALDIS, N.S. DAVIS, M.D. CHARLES L. MIX. M.D.
__________
ALEXANDER M. WILSON, SUPERINTENDENT - HOURS 9 to 11 A.M.
51 LA SALLE STREET " TELEPHONE MAIN 1466
July, 30, 1907,
Dr Howard A. Kelly,
1418 Eutaw Place
Baltimore, Md,
ck dep.
JulyAug 7
Dear Sir,
div1.p:
It gives me great pleasure to
add my little mite to the fund you
are raising toward the support of John R.
Kissinger. Thank you for the opportunity
offered through the columns of the Outlook.
div1.closer: Very truly yours, Alexander M. Wilson Please do not acknowledge.
